Common.LocationDescription.Common.Text: The property is located on the School Road in a densely populated area of Yardley Wood. The property is situated within a parade of independent traders fronting a large round about on School Yard Road.

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text:
The property is arranged over ground floor only.

Tenure
The premises are available by way of an assignment of the existing lease. Alternatively, the premises are available by way of a sub-lease for a term of years to be agreed.

Rates
We are verbally informed by the Local Rating Authority that the current Rateable Value of the shop is £21,000.00. Interested parties are advised to make their own enquiries with the Local Authority for verification purposes

Common.FloorPlans.Common.ImageCaption: 260 A_B GOSPEL LANE_ OLTON_ BIRMINGHAM - GOAD

Common.LocationDescription.Common.Text: Olton is an area within the Metropolitan Borough of Solihull in the West Midlands. It is located on the A41 between Solihull town centre, Acocks Green, and Birmingham. The subject property is located within a parade of shops fronting Gospel Lane and is surrounded by a number of independent traders.

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text:
The property is arranged over ground floor only, the ground floor is a regular shaped retail unit. The unit provides the following approximate areas and dimensions:

Tenure
The premises are available by way of an assignment of the existing lease. Alternatively, the premises are available by way of a sub-lease for a term of years to be agreed.

Rent
£14,500 per annum exclusive.

EPC
Energy Efficiency rating is C.
Energy Performance Certificate available on request.

Rates
We understand from the VOA website that the current Rateable Value of the shop is £11,500 and the rates payable are £5,646.50 pa. The UBR for 2019/2020 is 49.10p. Interested parties are advised to make their own enquiries with the Local Authority for verification purposes.

Common.Photos.Common.ImageCaption: 260 A_B GOSPEL LANE_ OLTON_ BIRMINGHAM_ B27 7AH

Common.LocationDescription.Common.Text:
Situated on the prominent corner position of Paradise Circus and Suffolk Street Queensway; Beneficial Building sits adjacent the Paradise Development which is one
of the biggest development projects Birmingham has seen for a generation and will bring a vibrant mixed
use scheme to the city with commercial, retail, leisure and hotel space in addition to a greatly enhanced
public realm.

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text:
VAT
Rents and prices are quoted exclusive of and
are subject to VAT.

Terms
The property is available to let by way of a new (effectively) full repairing and insuring lease for
a term to be agreed.
Rent on application.
There will be a service charge contribution toward
the common parts of the property.

Rates
RV to be assessed upon completion.

Common.LocationDescription.Common.Text:
The property comprises a ground floor retail unit which sits beneath a period style building arranged over nine floors with retail space at ground, lower ground and basement levels and office accommodation on the ground and upper floors.
The property is located in a prominent position overlooking Victoria Square and on the corner of Waterloo Street and New Street. Birmingham New Street and Snow Hill Train Stations are within easy walking distance.

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text:
The property is arranged over ground floor only.

Tenure
The premises are available by way of an assignment of the existing lease.

Rates
We are verbally informed by the Local Rating Authority that the current Rateable Value of the shop is £16,750.00 and the rates payable are £8,224.25 pa. The UBR for 2020/2021 is 49.10p. Interested parties are advised to make their own enquiries with the Local Authority for verification purposes

Common.LocationDescription.Common.Text:
Birmingham is home to the largest (and fastest growing) financial
and professional services sector outside London. With over 130,000
people employed in the sector, occupiers at One Snowhill enjoy
proximity to a number of the UK's foremost businesses, including
KPMG, PwC, Eversheds, EY, RBS, Barclays and Deutsche Bank in the
Birmingham business district.
The city is set to welcome the High Speed 2 terminus and an
extension to Birmingham Airport's runway, boosting the city's already
impressive connectivity. All this is accessible within a short walk from
One Snowhill, as well as the endless list of shops, restaurants, bars
and entertainment opportunities that Birmingham has to offer.

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text:
The property comprises a ground floor unit within One Snowhill that was previously utilised as a bar. The property
provides a large glazed frontage and is highly visible to passing traffic from Colmore Circus and pedestrians
travelling to and from Snow Hill station and the surrounding office accommodation. The property comprises open
ground floor space with ground floor W/Cs. The property also benefits from being located adjacent to the offices
of the West Midlands Police. The property comprises the following approximate dimensions and areas:

Tenure
The premises are available by
way of a new lease, for a term
of years to be agreed.

Rent
Rent on Application

Rates
From information provided by
the Valuation Office website
we are informed that the
current rateable value of the
bank is £31,000 . Interested
parties are advised to make
their own enquiries with the
Local Authority for verification
purposes.

Common.FloorPlans.Common.ImageCaption: 17 HIGH STREET_ CASTLE VALE_ BIRMINGHAM - GOAD

Common.LocationDescription.Common.Text: Castle Vale is a housing estate located between Erdington, Minworth and Castle Bromwich. The subject property is located on Castle Vale High Street opposite the library. There a number of independent traders in close proximity as well as Nisa convenience store and pharmacy.

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text:
The property is arranged as a ground floor lock up shop within a parade of shops. The unit provides the following approximate areas and dimensions:

Tenure
The premises are available by way of an assignment of the existing lease. Alternatively, the premises are available by way of a sub-lease for a term of years to be agreed.

Rent
£7,500 per annum exclusive.

EPC
Energy Efficiency rating is B.
Energy Performance Certificate available on request.

Rates
We understand from the VOA website that the current Rateable Value of the shop is £15,000.00 and the rates payable are £7,365.00 pa. The UBR for 2019/2020 is 49.10p. Interested parties are advised to make their own enquiries with the Local Authority for verification purposes.
